steps.title: Lay towels on the windowsills.
steps.content: Lay towels on the windowsills. You donâ€™t want the windowsills to get wet with the cleaning solution, especially if they are made of wood. Protect the windowsills by laying towels down over them. Make sure none of the windowsill is left exposed.

steps.title: Mix vinegar and water to make a cleaning solution.
steps.content: Mix vinegar and water to make a cleaning solution. Use four parts water and one-part white vinegar. Pour the water and vinegar in a bowl. You can pour the solution in a spray bottle if you wish to spray it onto the glass surface. You can replace the white vinegar for a few drops of liquid dish soap, if you want. [1] X Expert Source Jon Gholian Cleaning Specialist Expert Interview. 19 April 2021

steps.title: Dip the cloth into the cleaning solution.
steps.content: Dip the cloth into the cleaning solution. You can use a cotton cloth, microfiber towel, or even a newspaper to wipe down the glass, but a softer cloth is always the better option. [2] X Expert Source Jon Gholian Cleaning Specialist Expert Interview. 19 April 2021 Dip the cloth into the mixture. Or, you can spray the cleaning solution onto the cloth. Wring out the excess fluid. Spray the cleaning solution directly onto the glass if you are cleaning a large area.

steps.title: Wipe off the glass.
steps.content: Wipe off the glass. [3] X Expert Source Jon Gholian Cleaning Specialist Expert Interview. 19 April 2021 Begin by wiping the glass in circular motions. Then, wipe the glass with vertical strokes. After that, use horizontal strokes to clean the glass. Dry the glass using a lint free towel or newspaper as an alternative. [4] X Expert Source Jon Gholian Cleaning Specialist Expert Interview. 19 April 2021

steps.title: Clean the corners with a cotton swab.
steps.content: Clean the corners with a cotton swab. You can use a cotton swab, or an old, soft toothbrush to clean the corners of the glass window. Dip the cotton swab or toothbrush into the cleaning solution. Scrub the corners of the glass where dirt or dust may have gathered.

steps.title: Buff the glass.
steps.content: Buff the glass. You can use an old T-shirt, newspaper, or even cloth diapers to buff the glass. Rub the glass with your chosen object until it is dry and shiny.

steps.title: Clean out the crumbs.
steps.content: Clean out the crumbs. Begin by cleaning off the crumbs and other debris that may have accumulated on the oven glass. You can use a moistened cloth to loosen and pick up the crumbs. Or, you can use a vacuum attachment. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Create a paste with baking soda and water.
steps.content: Create a paste with baking soda and water. [6] X Expert Source Marcus Shields House Cleaning Professional Expert Interview. 22 September 2019. Pour a half or full cup of baking soda into a bowl. Add in only enough water to create a paste that resembles the consistency of shaving cream. Spread the paste over the oven glass. Allow it to sit for 15 minutes. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Scrub the glass.
steps.content: Scrub the glass. Use a dampened rag or microfiber cloth. Scrub the glass until it becomes clean. You may have to scrub firmly for tough grime and debris. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Rinse and dry off the baking soda mixture.
steps.content: Rinse and dry off the baking soda mixture. Rinse the glass off with water. You can use a wet cloth to do this. Make sure all of the baking soda has been washed off. Use a dry cloth to dry the glass. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Use a razor to remove grease stains.
steps.content: Use a razor to remove grease stains. If any tough spots are left, you can remove them with a razor. Gently scrape the spot with the razor. Make sure not to exert too much pressure, or you may scratch the glass. Once all of the remaining spots have been removed, wipe off or vacuum up the debris. [10] X Research source You can also use an abrasive pad that's specifically made for glass. [11] X Expert Source Marcus Shields House Cleaning Professional Expert Interview. 22 September 2019.

steps.title: Use a glass-cleaning microfiber towel.
steps.content: Use a glass-cleaning microfiber towel. You can find one online or at many auto parts stores. You can use a regular cloth, but it will probably not clean the glass as well as the glass-cleaning microfiber towel.

steps.title: Clean the glass with the damp towel.
steps.content: Clean the glass with the damp towel. Dampen the microfiber towel with water. You don't need to use a cleaning solution if you're using a glass-cleaning microfiber towel. Wipe down the glass until it becomes clean. You may have to scrub for dead bugs or other tough spots.

steps.title: Dry and buff the glass.
steps.content: Dry and buff the glass. Flip the towel over when you are finished cleaning off the glass. It should be dry on the unused side. Buff the glass until it becomes completely dry.
